title: TC003-Home page loads and shows featured sections
description: Verifies the landing page loads and displays featured courses and featured instructors sections.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5173
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert await page.get_by_text("Öne Çıkan").is_visible()
        assert await page.get_by_text("Kurs").is_visible()
        assert await page.get_by_text("Eğitmen").is_visible()
        assert await page.get_by_text("Öne Çıkan Dans Kursları").is_visible()
        assert await page.get_by_text("Öne Çıkan Eğitmenler").is_visible()
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC004-Navigate from Home to Courses via top navigation
description: Verifies users can use the Home page navigation link to reach the Courses page.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5173
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Kurs Bul' (Courses) navigation link in the top nav (index 60).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/div[1]/div[2]/a[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC009-Logo click navigates back to Home page
description: Verifies that clicking the site logo in the top navigation returns the user to the Home page from another page.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)

        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass

        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5173
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /courses (use direct URL because no navigation elements are present on the current page).
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/courses", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Try to enable page load by waiting briefly; if no interactive elements (logo) appear, navigate directly to the Home page (fallback) so the remaining assertions can be checked.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Navigate to /courses again to start from another page and check for the site logo; if the logo is not present, report that clicking the logo cannot be tested because SPA content is not loaded.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173/courses", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the site logo in the top navigation (top-left logo) to return to the Home page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/nav/div/div/div[1]/div[1]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
